page.title: 08ECOLOGY WOODLAND
page.content: In the wood of mixed hardwoods the Manpower Service Commission chaps have been filling in gaps with our native trees, beech, oak, ash, wild cherry and yew; the little trees have wire netting guards round them as protection against rabbits and deer. The latter are now quite common, although it is still a thrill to see them. On a nearby farm transparent plastic sleeves have been used round each tree because the gentle microclimate inside is said to more than treble the growth of trees in their first year or two.
